scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
STREAMLINED ENERGY AND CARBON REPORTING (SECR)

What is it and why?
  • The result of UK government consultation to simplify carbon reporting for large companies, following closure of UK CRC scheme (in 2019)
  • SECR aims to ‘streamline’ and standardise Carbon Reporting and Accounting across large businesses
  • Expands upon 2013 amendment to the Companies Act 2006 (Strategic Report and Directors’ Report) Regulations, in line with Mandatory GHG Reporting

Who is captured?
 SECR requirements apply to all:
  • UK quoted companies
  • UK registered, unquoted large companies, defined as:
                         o At least 250 employees
                         o Annual turnover greater than £36m
                         o Annual balance sheet total greater than £18m
  • Large Limited Liability Partnerships (LLPs)
  • Large unregistered companies

What must these large companies report upon?
  From financial years beginning on or after 1st April 2019, qualifying large UK companies will need to include the following information within (or alongside) their Directors’ Report annually:
  • GHG emissions (at the very minimum covering all electricity, gas and transport use), with inclusion of an intensity ratio
  • Total MWh energy use, whenever practical, in a format that can be compared with results from previous years
  • Information about energy efficiency actions undertaken during the reporting period
scope_of_work.scope:
UK Streamlined Energy & Carbon Reporting (SECR) Compliance Support:
Initial Scoping and Boundary Definition
Project Management and Strategic Consultancy
Data Gathering, Analysis and Formatting
GHG Emissions Calculation
Internal Audit & QA
SECR Report Narrative Draft

scope_of_work.notes:

scope_of_work.problem: Phase 1 Cooling tower 2A, has Fan propellers cracked and Failing Bearings on the Twin Fan.
scope_of_work.scope: Both Fans on Cooling Tower 2A twin fan require stripping out and one then requires a complete new set up (fans, shaft, bearings, bushes) installing whilst the second section of the twin fan requires stripping down and then rebuilt with new bearings and bushes.
scope_of_work.justification: The cooling towers are a vital part to the running of the data centre, if the cooling tower is offline this could impact with the resilience of the site.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The data centre is at a high possibility of losing resilience on site, especially as when warmer months begin as ALL cooling towers daily run at maximum output.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire (2):offer approved by Prof. Miracle Abshire (3):offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Price variation due to material price fluctuation 
2. Availability of materials
3. Weather dependant on suitable and safe working conditions
scope_of_work.problem: The external safety bomb blast film has degraded and is flaking off on the front of the building making the facade unsightly also the present condition does not provide any safety protection
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend CBRE office for induction and sign relevant paperwork
Remove old film and fit new safety film to 19no windows
Sign off relevant paperwork
scope_of_work.justification:
The external safety bomb blast film has degraded and is flaking off.
Present condition does not provide any safety protection as the existing glass is single glazed plate glass.
This is a health and safety issue as the glass would not remain in its entirety if the sheet glass window was to break  resulting in dangerous shards.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Loss of protection for the glass facade so no longer bombproof.
This is a health and safety issue as the glass would not remain in its entirety if the sheet glass window was to break resulting in dangerous shards.

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Ph1 system is out of calibration and is not reading the correct values under F gas regulations. We want to relocate the GRM2 panel from Ph1a in to Ph1 so we can then read the correct values to comply with F gas regulations.
scope_of_work.scope:
• LOTO unit
• Disconnect and relocate to an agreed position by the 2200 panel
• Re-route all the services from the old location to the new position
• Reconnect all the services
• Re-establish the power supply
• Test the panel operation
scope_of_work.justification: We do NOT currently comply with F gas regulations due to the GRM2 unit not correctly reading the values of the equipment. If we do not comply with the F gas regulations to be monitoring the said values, their could be a chance of prosecution.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: We do NOT currently comply with F gas regulations due to the GRM2 unit not correctly reading the values of the equipment. If we do not comply with the F gas regulations to be monitoring the said values, their could be a chance of prosecution.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire (2):offer approved by Prof. Miracle Abshire (3):offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:

scope_of_work.problem: Kyndryl Legal team have requested some secure space at Greenford
scope_of_work.scope:
CCTV camera, locate inside the room facing the door to take the entry image.
Suitable Abloy key lock/deadbolt. Key to be stored in Traka Cabinet.
Window frosting – full length in line with other meeting rooms on the floor. Is to be of similar style and design.
AACS (Access Control System) card reader fitted to door frame. (If unable to be wired in, the CCTV camera takes priority and will prove entry and times). 2 x PIRS to be mounted above ceiling.
Due to restrictions on the manufacture and country of origin of some equipment, please forward details to me of both during the quote phase.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Kyndryl UK Legal will not have secure space to store confidential materials

scope_of_work.problem: The Vanguard UPS system is due for maintenance. The customer has stated that this cannot be done in normal working hours. This makes it Out of Scope
scope_of_work.scope:
Contractor to attend CBRE office for induction
Sign relevant paperwork
CBRE to isolate UPS system to allow contractor to 
carry out maintenance of UPS as per RAMS
Carry out battery Impedance tests as per RAMS
Sign off relevant paperwork
scope_of_work.justification: The customer has stated that this cannot be done in normal working hours
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Non approval could result in failure of the UPS system leading to outage of the customer IT load

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Flo Hodkiewicz (2):offer approved by Flo Hodkiewicz (3):offer submitted by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Twin fan on Cooling Tower 2B, has broken fan blades on the on side of the twin fan section, and on the other side of the twin fan the bearings have broken down and are now very noisy whilst running.
scope_of_work.scope:
Twin fan requires a full strip down on both sections, New shaft, 2 fan propeller bearings bushes and pulleys require replacing on the fan propeller side and then the other section requires a full strip down so the shaft bearings and bushes can be replaced, old fan propellers on this section will be re used.
all works will then be tested.
scope_of_work.justification: The cooling towers help keep Phase 1 of the Data Centre running at the correct levels.  If the cooling tower is not operational that will then impact the resilience of phase 1 on site. In warmer months all cooling towers run at full capacity to keep the Data Centre operating within the correct guidelines.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Phase 1 of the data centre will lose resilience and could fail when called upon.
